author: Ed Nightingale
description:
Employees at Doom studio id Software have voted in favour of union representation with the Communications Workers of America (CWA), which has been recognised by Microsoft.

Read more
title: Developers at Microsoft-owned Doom studio id Software form union with CWA "to take back control of the industry we love"

author: Ed Nightingale
description:
Resident Evil Requiem's dual protagonists will represent two styles of gameplay, which its developers describe as like "jumping into a cold bath after a hot sauna".

Read more
title: Resident Evil Requiem's Leon and Grace will have differing gameplay like "jumping into a cold bath after a hot sauna"

author: Chris Tapsell
description:
UK trade union Independent Workers' Union of Great Britain (IWGB) has responded once again in the continuing war of words with GTA 6 developer Rockstar, this time describing the studio's latest statement, on its controversial firing of 34 employees, as an attempt to "reverse engineer a rationale for the dismissals."

Read more
title: "Littered with falsehoods and disinformation" - game workers union fires back at Rockstar's "lawless attack" once again, after GTA 6 maker's latest attempt to downplay controversial firings

author: Tom Orry
description:
Ace Combat 8: Wings of Theve is releasing in 2026, publisher Bandai Namco has revealed. The game, coming to PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC, was announced during last night's The Game Awards.

Read more
title: After a seven year wait, Bandai Namco's classic aerial combat series will return in 2026 with Ace Combat 8

author: Tom Orry
description:
Compulsion Games has revealed that its current Xbox console exclusive, South of Midnight, will be coming to other consoles in Spring 2026. The game, which is set in a fictionalised American Deep South and makes use of a stop-motion inspired art style, is now confirmed to be releasing on PS5 and Switch 2.

Read more
title: Current Xbox console exclusive South of Midnight to release on PS5 and Switch 2 in Spring 2026

author: Tom Orry
description:
Film adaptations of video games are pretty hot at the moment, with the likes of The Minecraft Movie and The Super Mario Bros. Movie making big money. Next year we're getting a new take on Street Fighter, and now we've got the first look at it in action.

Read more
title: 2026's Street Fighter movie gets first-look trailer, and it includes a great reference to the series' most famous bonus stage

author: Ian Higton
description:
Terminator 2D: No Fate's story mode opens with a shot of a rolling stretch of tarmac, its yellow centre lines infinitely scrolling past at regular intervals as moody, industrial music plays out behind it. It's a sight that should feel familiar to any fan of Terminator 2: Judgement Day, as it's similar, but not identical, to the final scene of the movie's theatrical release. The monologue that accompanies it is different too, delivered in the game by blocks of text rather than by Sarah Connor's distinctive whispered voice from the film.

Read more
title: Terminator 2D: No Fate review

author: Victoria Phillips Kennedy
description:
Sigourney Weaver has confirmed she has accepted a role in Amazon's upcoming Tomb Raider series from Phoebe Waller-Bridge.

Read more
title: "The scripts are incredible, and very funny" - Sigourney Weaver confirms she will play Wallace in live-action Tomb Raider series

author: Matt Wales
description:
Mega Man! It turns out Capcom hasn't forgotten about the blue robo-dude with the 'tude - last seen in his own mainline game seven years ago - after all. The publisher has unveiled a brand-new entry in its beloved action-platformer series, but you'll need to be patient as it's still a while away from release.

Read more
title: Mega Man's finally making a comeback, but his first big game in years is still a while away

author: Dom Peppiatt
description:
The Game Awards has only just wrapped, but already we've already got another (vague) date in our calendars: January 2026. Per an interview with Microsoft’s president of game content and studios, Matt Booty, in Variety, Xbox will be hosting one of its Dev Direct streams in January.

Read more
title: "We'll have more stuff next year" After being somewhat absent from The Game Awards, Xbox boss teases a Dev Direct for January 2026

author: Victoria Phillips Kennedy
description:
The Game Awards 2025 have come and gone, with Clair Obscur coming away with the coveted GOTY accolade. But, among the awards at the awards show, there was also a very generous smattering of trailers and reveals. And rounding out those trailers and reveals as part of Geoff's big finale was Highguard.

Read more
title: The Game Awards' big reveal this year was for a shooter from the creatives behind Apex Legends and Titanfall, and it looked... fine?

author: Robert Purchese
description:
Neon Giant, Swedish developer of cyberpunk shooter-RPG The Ascent, has unveiled its new game No Law at The Game Awards 2025. The game is in development for PC, PS5 and Xbox S/X, and will be published by South Korean company Krafton. There's currently no release date.

Read more
title: Think of a condensed Cyberpunk 2077 and you're somewhere near No Law, a new open-world shooter RPG from the makers of The Ascent

author: Ed Nightingale
description:
The previously revealed expansion to Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is available right now, as announced at tonight's The Game Awards.

Read more
title: Clair Obscur: Expedition 33's expansion is available right now, adding a photo mode and vibrant new world

author: Matt Wales
description:
The annual Geoffs are over for another year, leaving a massive Clair Obscur-shaped celebration in its wake. Not unexpectedly, developer Sandfall Interactive's highly acclaimed RPG was crowned Game of the Year at The Game Awards 2025, but what about everything else? Let's find out!

Read more
title: Clair Obscur is game of the year, but what about everything else? Here are the winners of the 2025 Game Awards

author: Dom Peppiatt
description:
It's finally official: we're getting a Total War: Warhammer 40,000 game. It's finally been announced at The Game Awards 2025.

Read more
title: Total War: Warhammer 40,000 is finally, actually real, coming to Xbox, PlayStation and PC - but has no release date

author: Ed Nightingale
description:
Chinese action game Phantom Blade Zero finally has a worldwide release date: 9th September 2026.

Read more
title: Eagerly-awaited Chinese action game Phantom Blade Zero finally gets a release date (and yes, it's still a PS5 console exclusive)

author: Victoria Phillips Kennedy
description:
To quote a certain Skywalker: "Now this is pod racing!"

Read more
title: Star Wars: Galactic Racer puts pod racing back on the menu

author: Matt Wales
description:
If you've been feeling a lacks of bumps in the night since purchasing your brand-new Switch 2, developer Kinetic Games has some spine-tinglingly good news for you: terrifying ghost-hunting horror game Phasmophobia is making its way to Nintendo's platform next year.

Read more
title: Mega-hit co-op horror Phasmophobia is coming to Switch 2

author: Ed Nightingale
description:
Housemarque's forthcoming sci-fi shooter Saros has received a new trailer at tonight's The Game Awards, as well as a slight delay.

Read more
title: Housemarque's Saros gets new trailer, and a short delay to its release

author: Victoria Phillips Kennedy
description:
Rock musician and Hunger Games actor Lenny Kravitz has been revealed as a villain in IO Interactive's Bond origin game, 007 First Light.

Read more
title: 007 First Light trailer unveils Lenny Kravitz's villainous side

author: Victoria Phillips Kennedy
description:
A from the ground up remake of the original Tomb Raider has been announced at The Game Awards.

Read more
title: Fully-fledged from the ground up Tomb Raider remake announced

author: Victoria Phillips Kennedy
description:
Crystal Dynamics and Amazon's all new Tomb Raider game has, after years of waiting, finally been revealed.

Read more
title: Next Tomb Raider game, known as Catalyst, finally revealed at The Game Awards

author: Victoria Phillips Kennedy
description:
You know when you see Remedy's name attached to a project, you are going to bear witness to a surreal and mind-twisting series of events. But with its newly announced action-adventure Control sequel - now officially known as Control Resonant - the studio has taken what it does best, and turned the volume up to 11, thanks to a warped Manhattan hellscape complete with kaleidoscopic pigeons and paranatural entities.

Read more
title: Control Resonant sends Jesse's brother, Dylan, to a perception-bending Manhattan at some point in 2026

author: Matt Wales
description:
Frictional Games, the studio behind the acclaimed Amnesia series, has unveiled its latest endeavour: a "spiritual successor" to its existentially harrowing sci-fi horror Soma. It's called Ontos and it's coming to Xbox Series X/S, PS5, and PC next year.

Read more
title: Stellar sci-fi horror Soma is getting a "spiritual successor" from the same studio, and it's set in a grim moon hotel on the edge of reality

author: Robert Purchese
description:
We've been waiting to find out what the new, internally made Wizards of the Coast Dungeons & Dragons role-playing game will be, and now we know: it's a third-person action adventure game called Warlock which is pulling on open-world and immersive sim ideas - and stars Battlestar Galactica's Tricia Helfer. Perhaps more to the point: it's not Baldur's Gate 4, or a follow-up in any way to Baldur's Gate 3, as some people, like me, had expected it might be.

Read more
title: It's not Baldur's Gate 4 - Wizards of the Coast reveals new internally made Dungeons & Dragons game Warlock

author: Robert Purchese
description:
Exodus, the sci-fi role-playing game that looks more than a little like Mass Effect, has had its release pushed back a bit. It's now expected in early 2027 rather than 2026.

Read more
title: "They can be pretty thirsty" - Mass Effect-like RPG Exodus has release date pushed back as studio talks companions, romances, and more

author: Matt Wales
description:
Fans conspired, and Capcom said no. Rumours swirled and still Capcom appeared to say no. And even after irrefutable evidence surfaced, the developer kept its lips sealed - until now. Leon S. Kennedy has finally officially been confirmed as a playable character in the upcoming Resident Evil Requiem - and much like Chris Redfield before him, the one-time twunk extraordinaire has formally been brushed with the taint of middle age.

Read more
title: Surprising absolutely no-one, Leon S. Kennedy confirmed for Resident Evil Requiem in new gameplay trailer

author: Robert Purchese
description:
The mystery of Geoff Keighley's demonic demon statue in the desert has been solved, and it belongs to Baldur's Gate 3 developer Larian, as suspected. More to the point, the statue was there to promote Larian's just-announced new role-playing game Divinity.

Read more
title: The Game Awards statue was for Larian's new game, Divinity, a new RPG that's "even larger than Baldur's Gate 3

author: Ed Nightingale
description:
A new Star Wars single-player RPG has been revealed, and it's a spiritual successor to BioWare's Knights of the Old Republic.

Read more
title: Star Wars: Fate of the Old Republic revealed, from Knights of the Old Republic and Mass Effect director Casey Hudson

author: Victoria Phillips Kennedy
description:
During this evening's (morning's?) Game Awards pre-show, Capcom treated us all to another look at its long in the pipeline astronaut and small girl-starring game, Pragmata.

Read more
title: Capcom's astronaut and small girl-starring Pragmata is coming to Switch 2, gameplay demo announced for Steam

author: Ed Nightingale
description:
The creator of Mario + Rabbids has revealed his next game, and it's a send up of the games industry as a mascot platformer: Bradley the Badger.

Read more
title: Mario + Rabbids creator's next game spoofs Bloodborne and more, in a mascot platformer parody of the games industry starring a badger
